flawed_nl_solution:
John runs 100-4=<<100-4=96>>96 meters once he reaches his max speed
He runs it in 13-1=<<13-1=12>>12 seconds
So he runs at a speed of 96/12=<<96/12=8>>8 m/s
So that means James's top speed is 8+2=<<8+2=10>>10 m/s
He has to run 100-10=<<100-10=110>>110 meters at his top speed
So he runs that at 110/10=<<110/10=11>>11 seconds
So he takes 11+2=<<11+2=13>>13 seconds to run 100 meters
#### 13

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 90, not 110. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
